title: [Self-Directed] 3D Gamification-Based Human Resource Development Education Design in Mathematics: Integrated Approach to Spatial Geometry, Probability, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational design theories, understanding of mathematics pedagogy, mastery of foundational concepts in geometry (coordinate systems, three-dimensional shapes) and statistics (mean, variance), and ability to design probability experiments
context.additional_context: 3D sandbox game-based learning via personal devices (BYOD), optimizing educational outcomes through mathematical modeling (functions/algorithms) and data analysis (statistical reasoning). Emphasizes real-world problem-solving using in-game physics engines and probability simulations.

learning_goals: Learners will design and operate a PBL (problem-based learning) project in a 3D gamification environment for human resource development training, applying mathematical problem-solving skills (e.g., equation and graph interpretation).

Using a 3D sandbox tool (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition), learners will design four math-based educational scenarios: spatial geometry (two 3D models: polyhedron volume calculation, coordinate system conversion), probability (one simulation: Monte Carlo method), and statistics (one data visualization: histogram and box plot). The project must achieve an 80% or higher fulfillment rate in peer evaluation and instructor feedback.

Learners will evaluate learning outcome metrics (PE, EE, SI, FC) using mathematical analysis methods (mean, standard deviation, correlation analysis) to improve educational satisfaction by 20% or more.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
